item.title: 10 Best Family-Friendly PS5 Games, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Family-friendly PS5 games like Promenade, Overcooked 2, and Just Dance 2024 Edition cater to all tastes.
  • Games like Overcooked 2 teach teamwork while being patient, not recommended for competitive players.
  • Just Dance 2024 Edition keeps the family active, but parents should beware of suggestive lyrics in songs.

This list of the best family-friendly games for PS5 is ranked according to OpenCritic’s highest percentage recommendation levels. Some of these family-friendly games include Promenade , Overcooked 2 , and Just Dance 2024 Edition . There are games to every taste, from simulation and adventure to racing and arcade titles.

One of the problems many families face is choosing a game that is both fun and age-appropriate. Engaging with games enables the entire family to enjoy quality time together and makes for a great weekend activity. In fact, according to UNICEF, parents should play video games with their kids as it will bring them together and create a stronger bond.

10 Promenade

Play As Nemo And Solve Tricky Puzzles

Released in early 2024 by Holy Cap, Promenade is suitable for children over 7 years old, allowing the family, including the little ones, to bond while playing. What makes this game family-friendly is the colorful and dynamic characters. The game’s goal is to collect different types of objects and solve all kinds of puzzles to progress to the next level. It's easy and user-friendly, and the calming video game music will eliminate stress levels during gameplay.

In addition, the game has an interactive, easy-to-follow story. It's ideal for beginners who aren't used to video games, but features enough depth to entertain more experienced gamers too. The end of the game is a bit more challenging, but in a good way—nothing too difficult. It also ends with a positive message by making a throwback to where it all began, leaving players feeling proud of their efforts.

9 Overcooked 2

A Chaotic Kitchen Adventure For Patient Gamers

With O vercooked 2 , fans love it or hate it, there is no middle ground. This option is ideal for patient gamers or for people who are trying to get better in that area. The game’s goal is to roleplay as a chef and prepare meal orders in a chaotic kitchen environment. What makes Overcooked 2 family-friendly is that it generates dialogue during challenging times, forcing players to work together despite the chaos of the kitchen. It also teaches how to work as a team to find solutions, not create problems.

Some players won't recommend this game to those who are overly competitive, as things can go south quickly and could be frustrating to those types of gamers. Communication skills are the key to success. Made with all ages in mind, this game is easy to play and can feature up to four co-op players at once.

8 Just Dance 2024 Edition

A Game To Put Dancing Skills To The Test

Just Dance 2024 Edition will get the whole family sweating with all its choreographed dances. The game’s goal is to complete all sequences of steps at a satisfactory level. 40 new songs are available for families to pick from, featuring artists like Miley Cyrus, REMA, and BLACKPINK. This family-friendly game is considered easy when it comes to difficulty.

The positive thing about Just Dance is that it keeps everyone active and on the move. It is also kid-friendly. In fact, it was nominated for the Kids’ Choice Award for Favorite Videogame . In addition, there is no sexual content; however, families should keep in mind that some of the songs contain suggestive lyrics.

7 Cuphead

A Challenging Cartoon-Inspired Game

Cuphead is a fun multiplayer game to play with the family. Some patience is required, as the game can be very challenging despite its simplistic appearance. With this in mind, an average skill level is needed, as Cuphead is not very beginner-friendly. During this game, the two players must deeply rely on each other to advance to the next level.

Cuphead 's creator, Jake Clark, presented this 2D game back in 2017, and his inspiration from 1930s cartoons like Mickey Mouse was plain to see. The game's soundtrack is by a jazz band, which was recorded live. Cuphead is entertaining, fun to play, interactive, and an award winner for Best Independent Game . It is officially recommended for players over 10 years old as some violence (non-realistic) and mild language are present.

6 Guitar Hero Live

A Classic Family-Friendly Game To Entertain The Whole House

Guitar Hero Live is a highly-rated, family-friendly game. Sometimes, the real challenge will be knowing when to stop playing. It was developed by RedOctane, and this multiplayer game has no violent language in its songs, so it’s appropriate for the whole family. In addition, some players have learned some basic guitar skills from playing, making it an educational game as well.

Guitar Hero Live has over 40 songs available to pick from, with each being ranked from easy to difficult levels. Artists like Fall Out Boy, the Rolling Stones, and Green Day are some of the big names included in this family game, which makes it a great way to introduce music into the lives of young gamers.

5 Untitled Goose Game

A Game Where You Get To Be A Goose For A Day

Developed by House House, Untitled Goose Game is an easy game to play, allowing people to be a loose goose for a day. It’s very entertaining, funny, relaxing, and appropriate for all ages. Players mention how hilarious the game is, as it allows them, while playing as a goose, to go around an Model Village and take items (without permission) from other people’s gardens, and then use them to cause mischief. It’s a short game, but it’s easily replayable with different people.

Untitled Goose Game is also an award winner for The British Academy Games Award For Family . In addition, it was also nominated for an award for The Best Game at the same awards show. It's an iconic indie game that knows what it wants to be, keeping things fun and light throughout.

4 Ratchet & Clank: Rift Apart

A Family-Friendly Adventure With Stunning Modern Graphics

Released in 2021, Ratchet & Clank: Rift Apart is a platforming adventure game, an award winner, and was nominated for the 2021 Game Award of the Year . What makes it family-friendly is its simple gameplay and interactive characters that appeal to all ages. Players praise this game for its attractive graphics, which resemble well-known Pixar or Dreamworks animations, and a bombastic and entertaining story.

In addition, it is also fun to play, with smooth controls and diverse weapons that feature visually-stunning animations and have amusing effects on the game's enemies. It also has adjustable difficulty levels, making it entertaining and the best game yet in the Ratchet & Clank series. While there is some cartoonish action throughout the game, it remains safe for younger players.

3 Unravel Two

A Teamwork Focused Puzzle Platforming Game

Unravel Two is a family-friendly game published by Electronic Arts. It falls under the adventure and puzzle platformer genre, and it is appropriate for the whole family, including little ones over 8 years old. The game’s goal is to solve all levels by working as a team, using the unique yarn tether between both characters to solve puzzles and progress through the story.

Unravel Two is a great family game because it requires communication and teamwork at all times. It's impossible to pass a level without the cooperation of the other player. Lastly, as proof of its quality, it won the award for Family Game of the Year .

2 Sonic Superstars

A Classic Family Game From SEGA

Released in 2023 by the Sonic Team, Sonic Superstars is an award-nominated platformer for The Best Family Game . Many gamers who are long-time fans of the Sonic games were impressed by the game's level design. No violence is presented in the game, making it appropriate for all ages.

Parent reviews of Sonic Superstars mention the ease of the gameplay, the graphical quality, the vibrant colors, and the great agility of the characters. The goal of the game is pretty simple—to destroy enemies and obstacles and pick up rings along the way. Interested players can also purchase the Sonic Superstars Deluxe Edition LEGO and play with Sonic, Knuckles, Tails, and Amy in a special edition adventure.

1 LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga

A Skywalker Saga-Inspired LEGO Game For The Whole Family

With 300 characters, 23 planets, and hundreds of vehicles to choose from, this multiplayer family-friendly game is a great selection for players looking to spend some time indoors. Published by Warner Bros., LEGO Star Wars , inspired by the Skywalker Saga , sold over five million copies, proving the success rate of the game. Fans of the LEGO franchise noted that what highlights this game compared to the previous ones is the quality of the camera angles.

Players can do split-screen multiplayer and join in anytime without the need to restart the game. Considered by many to be an easy game to play, LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga makes for a great choice for a family game day. In addition, it also teaches some problem-solving skills, and acts as a great introduction to the Star Wars franchise as a whole.

item.title: Monster Hunter Now: Best Gunlance Build for High Damage
item.description:
While not every weapon appeared at launch for Monster Hunter Now , the Gunlance was introduced not too long afterward. A mix between defense and offense, these weapons are best suited to those who love to be up close to monsters but also need to have some firepower to augment their power, and this build guide takes advantage of all of these traits.

Having said that, there are so many Monster Hunter Now monster parts that you need to get in order to put together the very best Gunlance build, and it's not just for the main weapon. Some of the monsters featured here are high-value targets, but this build is catered toward targets that are more commonly found outside of special events. Therefore, while Magnamalo and Coral Pukei-Pukei might be rarer hunts, you'll also be hunting Diablos and Banbaro to complete this set. Here is the best high-damage Gunlance build, complete with options for all the available Driftsmelt slots.

Best Monster Hunter Now Gunlance Build

The best weapon for a Monster Hunter Now Gunlance build is the Sinister Gunlance . This is a long shelling Blast-element weapon with the Partbreaker ability available at Grade 8, which helps increase the part damage it deals to breakable parts. The Blast-element slowly builds up over time, before erupting to deal a huge amount of damage all at once to the monster, reducing its health significantly, and thus making tougher hunts a little easier. The downside of this build is that it does require you to hunt many Magnamalos for the weapon, and several other armor parts also require tracking down Monster Hunter Rise 's flagship beast multiple times. Thankfully, you can track this monster via the Paintball Tracker.

Since we've already got a point in Partbreaker , we might as well increase it as far as we can, along with Weakness Exploit to make triggering an explosion with your Blast element more likely whenever you hit a monster's weak spot. Lock On will ensure that you can target a specific weak spot more easily, thus guaranteeing the aforementioned affinity synergy.

The other skills generally appear a bit sooner than the Weakness Exploit ability this Monster Hunter Now Gunlance build is centered around. For example, a couple of points in Blast Attack from the Vambraces speeds up the rate at which the Blast effect builds up. Sneak Attack , Offensive Guard, and Concentration are all nice to have, as they add more options to deal damage, build up your affinity in various conditions, or build your Special meter quickly.

Item

Effect

Weapon

Sinister Gunlance

  • Element: Blast
  • Shelling Type: Long
  • Partbreaker I (Grade 8)

Helm

Coral Pukei-Pukei Helm

  • Weakness Exploit I (Grade 5)
  • Weakness Exploit II (Grade 8)
  • Lock On I (Grade 6)
  • Driftsmelt Slot (Grade 8)

Mail

Banbaro Mail

  • Concentration I (Grade 3)
  • Partbreaker I (Grade 6)
  • Driftsmelt Slot (Grade 5)

Vambrace

Magnamalo Vambraces

  • Blast Attack I (Grade 4)
  • Blast Attack II (Grade 6)
  • Driftsmelt Slot (Grade 8)

Coil

Diablos Coil

  • Partbreaker I (Grade 5)
  • Offensive Guard I (Grade 6)
  • Driftsmelt Slot (Grade 5)

Greaves

Magnamalo Greaves

  • Blast Attack I (Grade 4)
  • Sneak Attack I (Grade 6)
  • Driftsmelt Slot (Grade 6)

Best Gunlance Build Driftsmelt Slots

The good thing about this build is that several Driftsmelt Slots are open at relatively low weapon ranks, meaning you can take advantage of this often-overlooked mechanic early on. All the recommended skills here are featured in the main build, so the intention is to elevate their levels further via Driftsmelt Slots.

Even though Concentration, Offensive Guard, and Sneak Attack were merely abilities accompanying more important ones in the base build, extra points for them via Driftsmelt Slots make the whole build come together nicely. The exception here is Critical Eye , which is an ability that gives you a flat increase to your affinity, but without the need to hit a weak spot. Here are our recommendations for Driftsmelt Slots for the best Monster Hunter Now Gunlance build:

  • Offensive Guard - Increases attack power for 10 seconds after executing a well-timed guard. Increases by 10% at rank 1 and 40% at rank 5 (Amber only)
  • Concentration - Increases the Special Gauge fill rate. Increases by 5% at rank 1 and 30% at rank 5. (Azure only)
  • Critical Eye - Increases your affinity. Increases by 10 at rank 1 and 50% at rank 5. (Cyan only)
  • Weakness Exploit - Increases your affinity when attacking a monster's weak spot. Increases by 20% at rank 1 and 50% at rank 5. (Pale only)
  • Sneak Attack - Increases damage when attacking a monster from behind. Increases by 10% at rank 1 and 30% at rank 5. (Pale only)

item.title: 5 Great Strategy Games With Unique Control Schemes
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Strategy games require patience and tactical planning
  • Unique control schemes can enhance the gameplay experience
  • Innovative features like voice commands and gyro controls add to gameplay excitement

Strategy games are very fun, but the reality is that they're not for everyone, as they require tons of patience, a good deal of tactical planning, and a deep love for sitting back and waiting for things to play out. Given how popular this genre is, there are strategy games touching on almost every subject. From ancient civilizations and World War 2, to futuristic interplanetary conflicts.

Playability is also a key concept that can make or break a strategy game, as some titles can be fun, but the way they're designed to be controlled might leave something to be desired. Here are some great strategy games with unique control schemes.

5 Pikmin

The One That Started It All

  • Olimar needs to collect all his ship's pieces to escape the mysterious planet
  • Some items require a specific amount of Pikmin

Pikmin starts when Captain Olimar crashes on a mysterious planet. He soon realizes that the only way to escape is by collecting his ship's parts, which have been scattered all over the surface. To help Olimar, players will have to grow different Pikmin, as well as control them as a group to perform various tasks.

This sounds simpler than it is, as players will have to plan out how they want their Pikmin to do their tasks and move the various objects required to progress through the game. Many objects are labeled with a number, which indicates the Pikmin required to lift them. While the control scheme itself isn't too complex or different in technical terms, the methods to control Olimar and the Pikmin to work together and achieve a mutual goal is very unique, and something that was rarely seen in other titles at the time.

4 Frozen Synapse

Player Control Relies Heavily On Planning And Different Routes

  • Players must use the top-down view to control their characters and find blind spots
  • As opposed to other strategy games, controlling units feels a little more restricted, but in a good way

Set in a futuristic environment, specifically in the city of Markov Geist, Frozen Synapse presents players with a unique concept, where the world has merged with a form of virtual reality inhabited by beings referred to as shapeforms. This game features turn-based combat that requires a ton of patience and careful strategic planning to ensure victory within the smallest possible timeframe.

During combat, players will have to give orders to a small squad of armed combatants in an effort to eliminate all opposing units. What makes Frozen Synapse so interesting and unique in terms of control schemes is not related to technical concepts, but rather to how players can control their units. Proposed pathways are marked in green, and players must use the top-down view to their advantage to find blind spots and areas of coverage to both attack enemies and avoid being hit. Controlling units in this game is a unique experience, as it doesn't feel as unrestricted as other titles, which might sound tedious, but somehow, it works.

3 Black & White

The Hand Of A God Has Many Different Abilities

  • Holding down on the mouse allows for continuous resource collection from a specific source
  • Players' hand is the hand of God, which adds another layer to the experience

Players who've ever dreamed of being an almighty god with thousands of followers praying to them and building shrines in their honor will love Black & White. In this great strategy game, players will be in control of almost everything that happens in their world, including resource management, and the fate of it.

Depending on players' decisions, the world will change for good or for worse, stemming from the choices of a kind, or an evil god. As players carry out godly acts, they will get more and more believers, which in turn makes them more powerful and able to control several aspects of the experience. One thing in terms of the control scheme that players would probably not have been able to figure out straight away without the tutorial, is that holding down the mouse on a specific resource like wood allows for its continuous collection. Moreover, the cursor is often represented as a hand, which can only be interpreted as the hand of God.

This changes things, as in strategy games, players are often just giving orders to units, but implementing an almighty force and seeing God's hand literally in action, is something else.

2 Tom Clancy's EndWar

Voice Commands Make Tactical Approaches Feel More Realistic

  • Set in a world where an energy crisis has crippled modern society
  • Players can use voice commands to tell their units who or what to attack

The events behind Tom Clancy's Endwar begin when a nuclear terrorist attack in Saudi Arabia kills six million people and interrupts the Middle East's commercial activities, including the import and export of oil. Soon after, the world plunges into a concerning energy crisis. Naturally, when something like this happens, chaos soon follows, and the world loses any established order that was ever in place. One curious thing about this title is that it was turn-based for handheld consoles, such as the Nintendo DS, and real-time for other platforms.

What makes Tom Clancy's Endwar 's control scheme so unique, is that often, the controller is not needed. This game implemented voice commands that players could use to tell their units who or what to attack by simply using specific words. This not only helped add much more realism to the gaming experience but also gave the title a unique approach to combat and strategy.

1 Fire Emblem: Three Houses

Controlling Pixel Byleth With The Switch's Gyro Controls Is Very Fun

  • Byleth is tasked with instructing students in a military academy
  • Players can control pixel Byleth with their Switch controller

Although the main character, Byleth used to be a mercenary, he finds himself a teacher in Fire Emblem: Three Houses . Tasked with instructing the young students of a prestigious military academy, Byleth will stop at nothing until the youngsters under his stewardship are well-prepared. Fire Emblem: Three Houses features amazing strategy mechanics that allow players to plan out their combat approaches in battle.

While this game doesn't feature unique control schemes during the majority of the story, there is a very fun and hard-to-discover feature inside it. During the game's loading screen, players will see a small pixel art Byleth at the bottom. While it might be hard to believe, it's possible to control him and determine where he runs with the Nintendo Switch's gyro sensor. This feature, while not at all useful in practical terms, is a fun little detail the developers added, and that took many players hundreds of hours to discover.

item.title: New York Times Connections Hints and Answers for #504 October 27, 2024
item.description:
Connections is a short little puzzle game you can play once a day. It pits you against sixteen words, and each one goes into one of four categories. However, the categories are secret, and your only clues are the words themselves.

If you want help with this difficult puzzle game, this guide is here to help you out. In it, you can find everything from general hints, spoilers, category clues, the full answer to puzzle, and a whole lot more.

Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #504 for October 27, 2024

The Connections puzzle for today contains the words: Fresh, Prince, Bel, Air, Quality, Bar, Cute, Mermaid, Lux, Wise, Tramp, Mood, Feeling, Smart, Mole, and Rascals.

Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle

If you are still stuck on this mind-boggling puzzle game, there are tons of hints below to help you. Open the expandable sections below with the Read More buttons below them to see the clues.

Some General Hints for the Whole Connections Puzzle

Yellow Connections Category Answer

Yellow Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Green Connections Category Answer

Green Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Blue Connections Category Answer

Blue Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Purple NYT Connections Category Hints

Purple Connections Category Answer

Purple Connections Category Answer and All Four Words

Answers for Today's NYT Connections #504 for October 27, 2024

The answer for today's New York Times Connections is in the expandable section below. If you open it up, you will find all the categories and the words that go in them.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Connections website, available on almost any device with a browser.

item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for October 27, 2024
item.description:
Strands is a short daily word puzzle from the New York Times Games. It is a more challenging version of your average word search; you are not given any of the words or the theme. You only get one little clue, and sometimes that clue is pretty helpful, while other times it is not.

If this puzzle game is giving you a hard time, this guide is here to help. Below you can find spoilers for some of the words for today's puzzle, spoiler-free hints to get you closer to the theme, the full answer to this puzzle, and more.

The NYT Games Strands Puzzle #238 October 27, 2024

The Strands puzzle for today has the clue Best of the Best . There are nine things to find in the grid, including the eight themed words and the Spangram category.

New York Times Games Strands Clues

If you are already familiar with the rules of how to play Strands , you know that there is an in-game hint system. Unfortunately, it gives away entire words, so maybe you want something a little less spoilery to help you. In the sections below, you can find three hints for the theme that won't contain any of the answers.

General Hint 1

General Hint 2

General Hint 3

Spoilers for Two of the Words in Today's Strands

This section contains two spoilers for the Strands puzzle for October 27, 2024. Open one up to peek at one of the two spoiled words with a screenshot of where each of the words goes in the grid.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands

The full answer to this relaxing puzzle game is in the section below. Open it up to see all the themed words and a screenshot of a completed puzzle showing where all those themed words go.

Today's Strands Explained

For a full breakdown of this minimalist puzzle game, open up the expandable section below. It holds an explanation of how all the words and the clue go together to make sense.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website, available on almost any device with a browser.
